description:
A spin-off of the Yuru Yuri series featuring Sakurako and her sisters. The first film of the Oomuro-ke duology.

(Source: Anime News Network, edited)

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Yuri
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two females, not inherently sexual. Also known as Girls' Love.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

node.description:
__Birthplace:__ Takaoka, Toyama Prefecture, Japan
__Residence:__ Kyoto, Kyoto Prefecture, Japan

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/_namori_/) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/124923) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/namoridane/)

Namori is a manga artist, best known for the manga [Yuru Yuri](https://anilist.co/manga/41593/Yuru-Yuri). She started attending painting classes around the age of 3 and she likes to work on her manga in coffee shops and other places outside. 

When she went to school, one of her classmates wrote "na" (the Hiragana "な") in a cute way, and Namori wanted to write it as well, hence her pen name starts with "na". The "mori" part does not stem from anywhere in particular.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/龍輪直征)

He began his career in 2000 as an animator at Studio Giants; in 2004, he began working for [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/), where in 2011 he made his debut as a director with [Katte ni Kaizou](https://anilist.co/anime/10191/). In 2016 he left Shaft and went freelance. In 2019, he started working for [Passione](https://anilist.co/studio/911/).

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/龍輪直征)

He began his career in 2000 as an animator at Studio Giants; in 2004, he began working for [Shaft](https://anilist.co/studio/44/), where in 2011 he made his debut as a director with [Katte ni Kaizou](https://anilist.co/anime/10191/). In 2016 he left Shaft and went freelance. In 2019, he started working for [Passione](https://anilist.co/studio/911/).

Masahiro Yokotani does series composition and scriptwriting.

Affiliated with KUSANAGI.

Representative director of Raretrick.

__Residence:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Blog](https://hh22.hatenablog.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/dne_bu_hh) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/ひらさわひさよし)

Hisayoshi is a sound director and animation producer, and also the chairman of the animation studios [Creators in Pack](https://anilist.co/studio/6072) and [Passione](https://anilist.co/studio/911/Passione).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hugo213546879) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/16287643)
Website | Twitter Japanese arranger, composer, and lyricist.
Website | Twitter Japanese arranger, composer, and lyricist.
Website | Twitter Japanese arranger, composer, and lyricist.
[Profile](https://www.s-inc.jp/artist/%e5%80%89%e7%9f%a5-%e7%8e%b2%e9%b3%b3/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kurachireo) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/reo_kurachi_s_official/)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ayasa_ito) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ayasacream/) A voice actor and the keyboardist of [Poppin'Party](https://anilist.co/staff/153185/PoppinParty). Ayasa used to live in Kyoto, before moving to Tokyo after graduating from high school in 2015. She played the piano ever since she was 3, but dropped it when she was in first grade. In middle school, she was made to try a voice acting part in the NHK Studio Park, and she then aimed to become a seiyuu after being praised for doing a good job at it. In 2010, she tried out for the Milky Holmes Seiyuu Audition Tour, but was knocked out of the at the semi-finals in the Osaka auditions. She later debuted as a voice actress after winning the role of Alice Myoujingawa in Futari wa Milky Holmes during the Milky Holmes Sisters Members Scout Audition on April 27, 2013. Together with Aimi Terakawa, they formed the unit Milky Holmes Feathers. Before dropping her high school activities in 2013 in order to study acting seriously, Ayasa was also the president of the Theater Club and part of the choir at her school. Ayasa's hobbies include watching cooking shows and theater plays and playing games. Among her skills are speaking in the Kyoto Dialect and hair arrangement. Ayasa is also an avid lover of the Takarazuka Revue, and fell in love with it after her grandmother took her to see one of their plays when she was in ninth grade. (Source: BanG Dream! Wikia, edited) Non-Anime Roles: - Cipher - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/824_aoi) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/koga_aoi0824/) | [Agency Profile](https://www.81produce.co.jp/actor_search/index.php/item?id=199) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/古賀葵)

Aoi Koga is a Japanese voice actress affiliated with 81 Produce.

Koga had an interest in anime since her childhood, watching series such as Cardcaptor Sakura and Ojamajo Doremi. She first became interested in voice acting after watching the television program Okaasan to Issho and becoming fond of the puppet segments featured in the show. This made her want to "become friends with dolls" and, along with her interest in anime, helped her decide to pursue a career in entertainment. In pursuit of becoming a voice actress, Koga would take acting lessons at a vocational school in Fukuoka. Following this, she enrolled in the training school of the agency 81 Produce, becoming affiliated with them upon her finishing her training.

__Awards:__
• Best Lead Actress at the 14th Seiyuu Awards in 2020 for her role as [Kaguya Shinomiya](https://anilist.co/character/120649/).

Non-Anime Roles:
~!
• [Paimon](https://anilist.co/character/203317/Paimon) - Genshin Impact (VG)
• [Kriemhild](https://anilist.co/character/343255/Kriemhild) - Fate/Grand Order (VG)
• [Rozaliya Olenyeva](https://anilist.co/character/207926/Rozaliya-Olenyeva) - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
• Ivy - Memento Mori (VG)
• [Kunimi Tama](https://anilist.co/character/321902/Tama-Kunimi) - Heaven Burns Red (VG)!~

__Height:__ 152 cm
__Agency:__ StarCrew

[Profile](https://www.starcrew.co.jp/talent/hidakarina/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hidaka_rina0615) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rina_hidaka615)

She announced on her Twitter account that she married the voice actor [Yuuma Uchida](https://anilist.co/staff/119617) on January 1st, 2024.

**Non-Anime Roles**:

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

A close personal friend of [Kozue Amano](https://anilist.co/staff/96937/Kozue-Amano). She was invited on stage to Anime Festival Asia 2011.

In 2013, she married a man from outside the anime industry.
